data.title: Excellent Bar for Music and Drinks
data.text:
I stayed at the Jefferson Hotel for my 10 year anniversary with my wife, and wanted to experience all the Historic Hotel had to offer.  We went to Quill every night while we were at the Jefferson!!  

A common theme with me is customer service, so it was amazing that when we approached the bar for the first time, the bartender, whom we had not seen prior to coming to Quill, wished us a Happy Anniversary in our very first greeting - amazing personal touch.  

The bar fare is awesome, with the fresh olives - I destroyed every olive that was put in front of me.

For the drinks - I love a strong bourbon and whiskey, but I enjoy having a good sweet cocktail with my wife.  We were not sure what we wanted to drink from the menu the first night - the bartender came over, asked if he could help and crafted us special made cocktails (slightly modified from the menu) based on our personal taste!  And he was spot on.  Service was fast, and efficient, and most importantly personal and courteous.  

On Saturday night, a world renowned Pianist came in, and was a great touch to an already amazing bar.  

I plan to take my friends here in the very near future!

user_location.name: Washington, District of Columbia, United States

data.title: Pricey but good
data.text: This is not the place to go for happy hour specials or discounted drinks.  Even a glass of wine will set you back at least $13, but the pours are generous, and you always get nuts and olives as complimentary snacks.  Never crowded if you need to have real conversation.

data.title: Step into the relaxation zone and bask elegance!
data.text:
Colleagues wanted to stop for a drink and someone suggested the Quill Bar in the Jefferson Hotel. 

Wow! They could not have suggested a more elegant place to unwind! The service was superb but it is the setting that is stunning! 

Walking past the historic documents and inlaid floors on the way to the bar is a peek at the environment to come. Then you enter an oak laden oasis. 

It feels like you are joining friends in the living room of their wealthy great uncle and letting you soak up a glimpse of how the other half live!! (Olives are served in beautiful pomegranate designed bowls. Water is poured from elegant jars. Seating is comfy and sophisticated). 

Now of course the drink prices are commensurate with the setting. But splurge and spend $20 on a treat.

I'm uploading the photo of Kentucky Orchard description and picture--bourbon with earl grey essence and cardamom. Beyond outstanding!!

data.title: Excellent Bartenders
data.text: Great place for cocktails. Bartenders offer suggestions to make your favorite drinks just a little bit better. Nice outdoor patio.

data.title: Best little bar in DC
data.text: Historic, quaint with excellent service and piano bar.  Great menu with numerous offerings.  The bartender the night we were there was mesmerizing.  A true artist and I could tell just by watching him the care that he took in preparing each beautiful cocktail.  Several large screen TVs in the bar area allow you to keep up with sports events while the other adjacent room is a little more spacious with the piano bar.  A great place to visit and spend the night after dinner or in lieu of dinner since the menu was so extensive.

owner_response.author: JeffersonDC, Manager at Quill, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear LindaMarieU,

Thank you for taking the time to post about your recent experience in Quill. I'm so glad that you enjoyed the food, cocktails and atmosphere and hope we can welcome you back in the future!

Sincerely,
David Bueno
Hotel Manager 
dbueno@jeffersondc.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Superb 5-Star Dining
data.text: There are several options for dining, all of which are total menus (appetizer, entree, dessert).  The best wine if you like a full-bodied red is The Chief.  And if you enjoy lobster, theirs is a must have!

data.title: Excellent!!!
data.text: Great place for hanging out. No need to have a specific reason to visit. Great ambiance and good service.

data.title: A Wonderful little Bar
data.text: The Quill is a very intimate bar in the Jefferson Hotel with wonderful drinks and food.  Sitting outside is as good as sitting inside.

data.title: Excellent Patio Bar
data.text: We loved having drinks and dinner out on the patio. The service was fantastic especially when Anui was in charge as the Bar Manager.  He made sure all his customers were acknowledged and greeted.  The nuts and olives were delicious and the drinks were great.  Food was really good and the ambiance was charming!

data.title: Fabulous little bar
data.text: WOW the service here is impeccable.  Almost serve you before you sit down.  Very professional, upscale but kind, friendly & courteous not stuck up.  Quality place, excellent drinks (maybe pricey).  Solid food menu here you can get dinner actually, late night nosh, etc.

data.title: Excellent service
data.text: High quality food and excellent service. I sat at the bar and had dinner. The atmosphere is very friendly and all of the servers take care of everyone. Beautiful inside. The piano table is very cool as well.

data.title: A bar setting at the Jefferson
data.text: We went for lunch. The setting is quiet and intimate and has a clubby feel. There is also outdoor seating. We ordered a pork Banh Mi sandwich and Wiener schnitzel. Both were served with French fries which were the best part of the meal. The sandwich was served on very good bread but the pork filling had a funky taste. The veal was moist and not overly breaded, however, it was bland.

data.title: Fun good eats
data.text: Service was excellent.  Menu was unique and the drink options were plentiful.  Proper service and knowledgeable staff.  Very comfortable tables.  Intimate and cozy.

data.title: Great spot to meet and talk
data.text: I went to happy hour here and had a wonderful experience. It was quiet and I was able to talk with my companion without yelling or without having to listen to the folks at the next table. The service was excellent and the drinks were reasonable (for DC).

data.title: Chill-Classy-Good Food
data.text: I always have steak there. I had steak at many places and this place is one of my favorites. The ambiance is great. On weekends there is someone playing piano there.

data.title: ~:-) Yumminess
data.text: Stumbled across the Quill while killing time while my wife was taking a nap. Amazing! I had to come back with my wife in tow for dinner!  Theo, our bartender / waiter,  was superb with his recommendations and service. He made me the absolute best Rye Manhattan and Boulevardier I've ever had!  My wife also raved about her raspberry lemon drop!  Their small dishes of complementary roasted nuts and olives were out of this world!  We thought we would just start with their charcuterie plate and then order something else.  That was more than enough! We did decide on a chocolate dish for dessert that was simply scrumptious! Can't say enough about how great our visit was! Try it. You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Dinner on the Patio
data.text: It was one of those rare summer evenings in DC where the humidity was low.  We had been driving all day so it was great to find out that we could dine outdoors at Quill.  We told our server that we were looking for a light meal and he recommended that we split a sandwich and order an extra serving of fries on the side.  While we were waiting for our food, we enjoyed a nice glass of wine.  Everything about Quill was perfect - food, service and atmosphere at a reasonable cost for DC.

data.title: superb food, drinks, service
data.text: Ate there for lunch and dinner and another night just for drinks. The food is superb. The service is superb; attentive waiters, waitresses, and bartenders.The drinks are superb. We had 4 different appetizers and 2 entrees over  the course of our stay. All were exceptional. Will return upon our next visit. Great for couples and business trips. Families were also there.

data.title: Class. Unique drink menu.
data.text: Pricey but nostalgic. Classy. You know some deals were made here. Historic place. Unique and nice drink menu. No frou frou drinks here. Great place to schmooze or not be seen. Mature atmosphere.

data.title: Fantastic hotel and an incredible bar program
data.text: The service at The Jefferson is impeccable. Quill, the hotel's bar, has some of the most knowledgeable — and friendly — bartenders in Washington. Quill staffers are excellent at covering all you might need for an evening out (including a terrific menu) in an elegant setting with classic cocktails and plenty of smart new ideas for drinks you never knew you might enjoy.
